Gwen Ifill reviews Donald Rumsfeld 's memoir,`` Known and Unknown'' Known and Unknown,'' a hefty and heavily annotated accounting and defense of his life in public service. Never much of a handwringer, Adlai Stevenson don't spend a lot of time in recriminations, looking back or second-guessing decisions made in real time with imperfect information by myself or others, he writes. She does it right, says longtime Harry Reid aide Jim Manley . Just days after her special-election win, the senator was working the phones on the 9/11 bill while en route to Afghanistan.
